info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 4:32PM EDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Lake County through 415 PM CDT... At 331 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over South Deering, or near Roseland, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and torrential rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hammond, Gary, Calumet City, East Chicago, Highland, Griffith, Whiting, Hegewisch and Burnham. Including the following interstates... Indiana I-80 between mile markers 4 and 9. Indiana I-90 between mile markers 1 and 16. This includes...Purdue University Northwest Hammond and South Shore Rail Cats Baseball. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
